events.description: The Turkish BIST 100 stock index reached a record high of 13,800 in February.
The Central Bank of the Republic of Turkey (TCMB) cut its benchmark interest rate by 100 basis points.

facts.fact_text: Turkey’s BIST 100 stock index reached 13,800 in February.

evidences.evidence_text: Turkey’s BIST 100 stock index surged to 13,800 in February, a record high

facts.fact_text: Aselsan shares increased by nearly 300% compared to the previous year.

evidences.evidence_text: Aselsan shares were nearly 300% higher from the previous year

facts.fact_text: The TCMB cut its benchmark rate by 100bps last month.

evidences.evidence_text: The TCMB cut its benchmark rate by 100bps last month

claims.claim_text: Heightened geopolitical tensions in Europe and the Middle East are driving higher defense spending from NATO members.

evidences.evidence_text: higher defense spending from NATO members due to heightened geopolitical tensions in both Europe and the Middle East

claims.claim_text: Investors are utilizing equities as a hedge against inflation due to the predictable decline of the lira.

evidences.evidence_text: The predictable decline in the lira has also allowed investors to use riskier assets such as equities to protect themselves against inflation.

claims.claim_text: Underlying inflation in Turkey is expected to continue to slow this year.
claims.author: TCMB

evidences.evidence_text: reiterated that its baseline scenario sees underlying inflation continue to slow this year

evidence.evidence_text: higher defense spending from NATO members due to heightened geopolitical tensions
The predictable decline in the lira has also allowed investors to use riskier assets such as equities to protect themselves against inflation.
Banks also outperformed in the recent quarters... spurred by credit activity
